frameDefinitions: This frame contains perception words whose perceivers intentionally direct their attention to some entity or phenomenon in order to have a perceptual experience.
The Hearer receives a Message or communication on a particular Topic.
Words in this frame have to do with a Cognizer adding some Phenomenon to their model of the world.
An Entity began its existence in the context of a Origin, which can be a place,  culture, time period, text, etc.  'The Christian origin of this quote is from Isaiah 22.'
An Agent initiates the beginning of an ongoing Activity in which he will be continuously involved. ''
This frame contains perception words whose Perceivers have perceptual experiences that they do not necessarily intend to.
frameExamples: Teenage fans first <t>heard</t> about the tragedy on a popular radio show.
Later that night, they <t>found</t> the barely-alive victim inside the Red Hall estate flat.
The Christian <t>origin</t> of this quote is from Isaiah 22.
At the same time, city-states <t>began</t> to grow in influence on the southern Greek mainland.
Abashed, realising that he had <t>overheard</t> her conversation with Victoria, Sheeley didn't try to make excuses.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Perceiver_agentive</fen> performs some action in order to have a perceptual experience. It is expressed as an External Argument:

<fen>Phenomenon</fen> indicates the entity or phenomenon to which the <fen>Perceiver_agentive</fen> directs his or her attention in order to have a perceptual experience. Typically, it is expressed as an Object with verbs.
<fen>Body_part</fen> identifies the part of the body used as a sensory organ of the <fen>Perceiver_agentive</fen>, typically expressed in a <ment>with</ment>-PP.

<fen>Direction</fen> is used for all path-like expressions that describe how the perceiver's attention is directed during the act of perception, with the exception of those indicating the location of the <fen>Perceiver_agentive</fen> (which would be marked <fen>Location_of_perceiver</fen>)
When the activity of attempting to perceive occurs.
The general location within which the act of perception takes place.
This role is the person who receives a Message. It is expressed as an Exteranal Argument in this frame:
The Message is the content that is communicated from one person to another. It is normally expressed as an NP Object or a finite clause Complement:
Topic is the subject matter about which the Message is communicated. It is normally expressed as a PP-complement headed by <ment>about</ment>, with or without a quantificational noun:
The <fen>Time</fen> the <fen>Hearer</fen> receives the <fen>Message</fen>.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person who becomes aware of a <fen>Phenomenon</fen>. It is normally expressed as an External Argument.
Thm <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is the entity or situation in the world of which a <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes aware. It is normally expressed as an Object:
This role identifes the <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes aware of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
<fen>Topic</fen> indicates the general field within which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is found.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> uses an <fen>Instrument</fen> to (enable themselves to) become aware of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.  In some cases, the <fen>Instrument</fen> may appear in subject position.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes aware of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The item whose <fen>Origin</fen> is under discussion.
The place or culture where the <fen>Entity</fen> was produced.
This role identifies the <fen>Activity</fen> that an <fen>Agent</fen> starts.
This role identifies the being that starts the intentional <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> starts an <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> starts an <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role is the being who has a perceptual experience, not necessarily on purpose. It is typically expressed as an External Argument.
This role is the entity or phenomenon that the perceiver experiences with his or her senses. It is typically expressed as Object with verbs.
The <fen>Body_part</fen> is the location on the <fen>Perceiver_passive</fen>'s body where the perceptual experience  takes place.  It is typically expressed in a PP.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Perceiver_passive</fen> or the <fen>Body_part</fen> perceives the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The general location within which the act of perception takes place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The waiter</fex> smelled the milk to see if it was fresh.
The waiter smelled <fex>the milk</fex> to see if it was fresh.
You should feel the water <fex>with your toes</fex> before jumping in.
The detective looked <fex>across the street</fex> at the suspect.
<fex>The students</fex> heard from Pat that class was canceled.
I heard <fex>in June</fex> that Pablo left, how sad!
<fex>Pat</fex> discovered a great little restaurant in Soho.
Pat discovered <fex>a great little restaurant</fex> in Soho.
<fex>By opening the book to page 10</fex>, you will find the Van Eerdens' number.
Scientists attempt to make discoveries <fex>about the laws of nature</fex>.
Olson says the deputy came out to the farm and detected a radioactive substance <fex>with his Geiger counter</fex>.
Robbie had wondered if they would be able to find the path <fex>at night</fex>.
<fex>The waiter</fex> smelled something foul in the kitchen.
The waiter smelled <fex>something foul</fex> in the kitchen.
Marlow felt something cold and hard <fex>against the back of his neck</fex>.
